sentence.Network_en: This was not a mere empty vaunt , but a deliberate avowal of his real sentiments.
sentence.Network_cn: 这倒不是一个空洞的吹牛, 而是他真实感情的供状.

sentence.Network_en: They pour forth words, they speak arrogantly; All who do wickedness vaunt themselves.
sentence.Network_cn: 诗94:4他们絮絮叨叨 、 说傲慢的话. 一切作孽的人、都自己夸张.

list.abs: and it rolling on May 23 , when Cabrera's walk-off double earned him the vaunted championship belt and another pie to the face .火力持续在五月23日燃烧，牛奶又敲出一支再见二垒安打，为他自己赢得了一条夸张的冠军腰带，他的脸上也再一次被砸了派。
This was not a mere empty vaunt , but a deliberate avowal of his real sentiments ., 这倒不是一个空洞的吹牛 , 而是他真实感情的供状.
They vaunted into the new boy ., 她们挖苦起那个新来的男孩.
kids need a range of authentic role models -- as opposed to members of their clique , pop stars and vaunted athletes .孩子需要一系列真实的行为榜样，这与他们小圈子里的成员，流行歌星及自负的运动员不同。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: the noun a shortening of obsolete avaunt 'boasting, a boast'; the verb (originally in the sense 'use boastful language') from Old French vanter, from late Latin vantare, based on Latin vanus 'vain, empty'

auth_sentence.content: The development is a particular blow to the psyche of the locals, who vaunt Vermontitude.
